Hi all,

Sorry for not following this discussion - I've been moving
universities recently and have a lot of stuff to catch up with...

Yes, that Le Monde was interested was a bit of a surprise to me too.
The competition's also been on the front page of Yahoo! Japan, on
MSNBC, New Scientist etc. It's weird how easy it is to get attention
for something which is not even really research in my view, whereas
it's much harder to get attention for more interesting stuff.

Dzafar: Now it's past the first deadline, but the second deadline is
in about two week's time... We will change the interface slightly, but
only through introducing some new information that the agent can
choose whether to use or not.

Ken: It seems Jan Koutnik hasn't put his HyperGP paper online. You can
mail him and ask. There's a very short description in our Mario paper:
http://julian.togelius.com/Togelius2009Super.pdf
Feeding the fine-grained visual information to the agent would
certainly be very interesting, and maybe not much harder than the
chunky feed we have now, at least with HyperNEAT/HyperGP. Maybe we
should extend the interface to include this...

Julian

2009/8/7 dzafar.sadik <dzafar.sadik@...>:
>
>

>
